passages.name: Prologue
passages.text:
Prologue

Welcome to "Into The Dark", an Interactive Fiction inspired by the dark and terrifying tales of medieval times. Take control of monster hunter & mercenary Jacobi Kozlov, and delve into the dangerous and unknown. There is a good chance you will die, but don't worry. Just use the save feature in the sidebar at any point in the story you feel like, but be aware that only one save file is available at any time. Good luck, and enjoy the story. [[And So It Begins...->Chapter 1:The Hunt]] Music by: Main Song: Hitctrl, 2017, "RPG_Ambient_2", //OpenGameArt//, audio download, accessed 18 September 2017, https://opengameart.org/content/rpgambient2 DungeonSong: Alexander Zhelanov, 2015, "Dark Ambient", //OpenGameArt//, audio download, accessed 18 September 2017, https://opengameart.org/content/dark-ambient-0

[[Contemplation]]

passages.name: Jacobi Kozlov
passages.text:
Jacobi stared back at the stone walls of the city Mayazar. A hulking grey fortress standing as the capital of Magia, it was a walled city known to all inhabitants as impenatrable. //For safety and comfort is the greatest treasure of the weaklings of this city,// thought Jacobi as he guided his horse South and away from the city. 

Ahead of him lay a 2 day's ride toward the small village of Toreal, where word of a beast hunting in the woods had attacked villagers. The long ride there gave Jacobi time to think how he had been practically forced into [[this situation.|Mayazar]]

passages.name: Mayazar
passages.text:
Mayazar City - Guard Barracks

Two Days Earlier

Jacobi stared at the entrance of the guard barracks of Mayazar. Unlike the city walls the building did not strike fear into the heart, but rather seaped opulence from every opening. Every window was spotless, the walls wiped clean and the redwood door appeared almost new. //Mustn't be much crime here if these lazy pigs can afford time to clean this much,// thought Jacobi, as he [[opened the door.|Inside the Barracks]]

passages.name: Inside the Barracks
passages.text:
The inside of the barracks was as spotless as the outside. Long dining tables stretched across the inside of the bottom floor along the Jacobi's left hand side, enough seats to fit a hundred men at least.

The Captain of The Guard's office was down a hall to the right of the entrance, where Jacobi would find the man who would send him on this godforsaken mission.

<center>[[Walk down the hallway|Door]]</center>

passages.name: Door
passages.text:
Jacobi walked up to the room marked "Captain" with very little resistance. The few guards he did see barely even recognised his existence. 

A life of luxury had apprently given the men inside the walls a feeling of false security. If they knew what dwell outside the walls their would be very different perhaps.

Jacobi stood in front of the Captain's office.
[[Knock on the door|Knocked]]
[[Turn knob and enter|Turn The Knob]]

passages.name: Turn The Knob
passages.text:
Jacobi confidently turned the knob and entered the room without warning. He was not a man of patience nor civility. Inside was William Archer -a large, plump man who was captain of all city guards south of the palace-peacefully snoring away, unaware of the fact he might have visitors.

Underneath his chin and slobber, there were papers containing military orders sprawled across the desk. Jacobi quickly glanced over them, reading:

''Southern Supp...............uption''
''..stern Insurre.........tle Plan''
''Mountain Cas...............''

The sleeping giant's body covered some of the writing, making it difficult to read without disturbing him, and with that he awoke.

Flustered he looked at Jacobi, who held a sinister grin across his face, and quickly stuffed the papers into a drawer.
"They said I should be expecting a guest but not this bloody early," he proclaimed, as though it would excuse his nap.

[[Listen to what he has to say.|William's Office]]

links.text: Listen to what he has to say.

passages.name: Knocked
passages.text:
Jacobi knocked on the door only to hear a slight mumbline, and decided if someone was in there, then he might as well head in.

As he entered the room he heard a slight shuffling and movement, as though someone was hastily reorganising something. The man behind the desk in the room was William Archer, a large, plump man who was in charge of all city Guards south of the central palace.

[[Listen to what he has to say.|William's Office]]

links.text: Listen to what he has to say.

passages.name: William's Office
passages.text: "So you're Jacobi Kozlov ey,", he snorted, his cheeks bouncing with every syllable. "We've heard of you around here you around here you know.Even all the way down here in the South." <> <> "Oh yeah," smirked William. "Kozlov the Great. The Silver Shadow." Referring to Jacobi's unusually white hair. "There isn't a guardsman here who hasn't heard the stories of the one-eyed monster killer. And there isn't a man here who hasn't heard of his fall from grace. Leaving your post in the middle of a battle." "Disgraceful', he finished, practically spitting the word onto Jacobi's feet. True, he may have left in the War of The Red, but there were more important things at stake. <> <> [["What's the job?"|The Forest Brief P1]] Jacobi grunted at the man, wishing to get it over with.

passages.name: The Forest Brief P1
passages.text: "Yeah he said you wouldn't be easy to work with either,"stated William, as he passed a rolled parchment to Jacobi. The parchment was stilled sealed, with the royal insignia of the Twinning family of Mayazar stamped into the wax. "Your Orders", said William <> <> "It's for the best that I don't say, I'm sure you understand." he said with a sly grin. <> <> [[Listen to William|The Forest Brief P2]]

passages.name: The Forest Brief P2
passages.text:
"In short, we need you to head South, apparently there's some beast terrorizing the village of Toreal and it's causing some headaches for Mayazar's carpenters"

The village of Toreal was indeed important for any woodworker in Mayazar, as the surroudning forests were cut down a millenia ago to make way for the city. Nowadays, almost all wood supplies were carted from Toreal due to the forest it was built next to.

The situation began to unfold before Jacobi's eyes. Those higher up needed the issue resolved before the supply chain came to a grinding halt.

Bringing in an outside force such as himself meant there was no threat to their own forces, and no word would spread about the situation, whether Jacobi was succesful or not. //Suspicious,// he thought.

//Suspicious or not, the Gold will make things a lot better if I can do this quickly//

[[Take Orders|Weapon]]

"Now I was also informed to take stock of your weaponry," sighed William, who began to jot down all of Jacobi's visible equipment.

"Just to make sure if you find something out there, you don't try and take what belongs to his Majesty Sir Twinning," a sly grin running across his greasy face.

"I see you've left your weapons with the horse. What are you carrying with you?

[[Dwarven Great Axe|Great Axe 1]]

"Anyway, you had better get going." He yawned, clearly wanting to return his slothlike, resting state.

Jacobi turned to exit the office before William quickly blurted out,
"And don't expect payment without bringing back the damn thing's skull."

passages.name: The Journey Ahead
passages.text:
The sound of Jacobi's gear shuffling and his horse steadily trotting along was all that could he could hear for most of the journey South. //Quiet, like a graveyard this area is,// he pondered to himself. The fields south of Mayazar were indeed a killing ground. During revolutions of past times many battles had been fought here, and ancient grudges from southern Lords and men had been born and died here.

These days however, Jacobi should have been able to see trade wagons coming from the South, but not one had passed him in the 2 days of travel it took to get to Toreal.

//Problems seem to be getting worse in Toreal than what William was letting on,// he thought, as the desolate village began to come into view.

passages.name: Toreal
passages.text:
As Jacobi entered Toreal he quickly began to look around and try to take stock of the situation. Around town, villagers seemed to look frightened or downtrodden. //They might have something they can tell me,// he thought to himself.

The logging camp to East of town appeared abandoned. //The threat of whatever was in the woods must scared the men off,// he surmised.

In the centre of town was the tavern and the general goods store, and they too looked as if they had not had customers in a while.

//Or perhaps I could just get this over with and head into the damn forest. I'm sure to find whatever's out there sooner or later.//

[[Walk Around Town|Villagers]]

Jacobi headed towards the local store, just east of the Inn down the road. The town had fallen into disrepair these last few months, and it was showing. Gardens overgrown, vagrants in the streets, and hardly a word among what few commonfolk roamed the street. The silence was almost tangible, a physical thing clinging to the town, strangling the life out of it.Upon arriving at the store, the small bell above it's door signally the arrival of a customer rang out, cutting through the silence like a blade.
<<else>>
The store was still quiet, with the old man sitting behind the counter, reading a small book.
<<endif>>

passages.name: Town Crier
passages.text:
Jacobi approached the Town Crier as he expelled the daily news to anyone who would listen, leaning against a nearby fence and taking in what he had to say. A few vagrants sat nearby, barely taking in a word.
He talked of recent events in the town; marriages, births, supply chain news and information from Mayazar, and recent deaths in the town.

It was a long list of deaths.

[[Villagers]]

passages.name: Young Woman
passages.text:
<<if $girlTTalk is false>>
Jacobi eyed the young woman, a frail girl with wispy brown hair and appeared to be only in her early twenties. As Jacobi moved closer he could see the fear and distress in her eyes, clearly the town's recent events had taken a toll on her.
Whereas most villagers Jacobi had seen upon enetering Toreal were sunken and depressed, this woman was shaken to her core. //This one might know more about the beast than the rest of these dull-eyed cowards.//
[[Talk to The Girl|Miranda]]
<<else>>
Miranda sits in the streets by her home, staring longingly towards the forest, a mix of fear and hope resting in her eyes.
[[Talk to Miranda|Miranda]]
<<endif>>

[[Villagers][$Twalk to $Twalk+1]]

passages.name: Inspect Work Stations
passages.text:
While inspecting the work stations Jacob came across a map of the nearby forest. It showed the paths the men had used to cart the logs out of the area and back to their campsite. In the South Eastern area a clearing had been marked with multiple warnings.
"Warning!"
"Stay away!"
"Danger!"
"Beast!"
//So these men found the damn thing already. I wonder how much of them lost their lives before someone had the common sense to send a professional.// Jacobi's fists clenched. Too many innocent lives had been lost here.
[[Return to main Logging Camp Area|Logging Camp]]

<<set $forestMap to true>>

links.text: Return to main Logging Camp Area

passages.name: Search Logging Camp
passages.text:
The logging camp appeared deserted. Tools and wood axes were scattered around the worksite, and it seemed as though no one had worked here for some time. The place was still in working order by the looks of things, but it seemed as though dust had slowly begun to settle here.
//How long has this been going on?// wondered Jacobi.
//If this is the largest wood supply of the Kingdom why is the King only now dealing with this situation?//
Such questions were worth asking another time.
Among the camp were a few torches left behind by some of the men, oil covered cloth wrapped around a thick piece of wood.
//I'l probably be needing these soon,// sighed Jacobi as a collected them

+2 Torches

passages.name: Off-Duty Guard
passages.text:
Jacobi waited for the guard to regain some form of consciousness before questioning him, getting an ale while waiting. After a few short minutes he awoke and began rising from his seat. Jacobi quickly finished his drink before speaking to him.

"Friend please sit down," Jacobi said, putting ona fake smile, to trick poor the drunkard. "The night's barely begun. An ale for the Guardsmen," he said, flipping the barkeep a copper piece. The guardsman face brightened up upon hearing of a free drink, and he sat down again, still quite groggy from his previous bout. 

But right before the first drop of liquor touched his lips he stopped, and stared at Jacobi. 
"Wait a minute!" he yelled, swaying. "I know you, the famous Killer Kozlov, they called you. But that was before you ran from the fight."

The guardsmen stood up and stumbled his way out of the bar, "Filthy bloody Kozlov", he muttered.
"The whole city was burning and you have the nerve to run off. I lost my family when those bastards invaded!! You think I didn't want to leave to save them too?!"he continued to yell as he walked out into the streets to find a place to sleep.
<<set $drunkGuard to true>>
[[Tavern]]

passages.name: Barkeep
passages.text:
"An ale, please, I've had a long trip," called Jacobi to the barkeep, placing a copper piece on the counter. The barkeep brought a large wooden mug over to Jacobi, filled with a thick brown brew that smelled of pine and liqour. After he tooke a sip the barkeep began to speak,
"So you're here for whatever's in these woods ey?" he said, casually leaning against the back wall.
"What tells you that?" asked Jacobi, drinking from the mug.
"The armour, the weapon on your horse," he nodded towards the post across the street where Jacobi had left his horse tied. "And o'course, that look in your eye. Like you've seen battle and you know it's coming again soon." He said, edging ever closer with every word.

Jacobi shot a cold glance in his direction, and took a few steps back.
"Listen, i've lost a lot of good customers to whatever is in there. I hear it's got claws like blades and the eyes of a demon. Say you are going in, you're probably going to need these."
The barkeep searches beneath the counter for a short moment, until revealing a small pouch. He hands it Jacobi, inside is 2 rolls of gauze and a small jar of medicinal paste, the kind that was used in the war and developed by Mayazar's top alcehmists.
On the front, is a faded symbol showing a banner with a black tower, the symbol for the elite guards of Mayazar.

"Where did you come across this?" pried Jacobi.
"I've been around a lot longer than you, Monster hunter," the old man smirked, and returned to cleaning his jugs.

+2 Gauze
+1 Medicinal Paste

passages.name: Talk To Shopkeep
passages.text:
Jacobi approached the old man behind the counter serving as the shop keeper. The old man would've stood barelu 5 feet high if he weren't sitting down, and was covered in wrinkles, older than Jacobi by a great many years. His face was shrouded by his thick, curly, dry beard and he still held a good amount of hair on his head. 

"New in town are ya?" creaked the old man before Jacobi had a chance to speak.
"Ye-," Jacobi began,
"Well you'll be wanting to get out quick, they say there's something in them woods that ain't right."
"Well that's what I'm here about," replied Jacobi, "You could say I'm interested in whatever is out there."
"Well," started the old man, "It ain't human, but it looks like one, so the folk at the logging camp been saying. 'Course they all left town now, too dangerous for 'em out there.Other 'en that not much to say about it, 'cept that no one been in there and come back in one piece lately."
He paused.
"Now are you gonna buy some'in or are ya just wasting my time?"

passages.name: Approach The Lair
passages.text:
<<set $positionX += 1>>
Jacobi edged towards where the logging camp map had noted the "Danger" area. As he moved through the forest path he suddenly approached the clearing the map had marked. The thick canopy of trees had broken here, and Jacobi could see it was almost nightfall, and that his torches would still be useful for walk back to Toreal.

In the center of the clearing was a small lake,with dirt and algae turning it to a foul brown colour. He scanned the clearing more thoroughly, drawing his $weapon.
//The beast is here alright, I can smell the blood in the air,// he thought, edging slowly into the clearing.

And then, in the corner of his eye he spotted it. A sharp movement in the underbrush, disturbing the leaves and cracking twigs as it darted about. And then, as though it's rustling were a warning, it leapt from behind the trees and bushes.

As it ran towards him Jacobi had mere seconds to recognise his enemy. A monsterous Ghoul. Born into the world from the darkest depths of humanity they thirsted for human flesh. Generations of cannibalism  and depravity and turned what should have been human into an insane, hungery and deranged beast wanting nothing more than to rip the flesh from living creatures.

It stood a good seven feet tall, even with a hunch, and on ecah hand had three long nails as sharp as blades and covered in sickly, dry blood. It's dark hair was tattered and in knots and it's face was covered in sores and cuts. It's mouth was wide open and Jacobi could see it's razor sharp teeth as it launched itself towards him.

With ony seconds to react, Jacobi...

[[Dodges The Ghoul|Dodge Ghoul]]
[[Blocks the Ghoul|Block Ghoul]]

<<set $ghoulHealth to 40>>

passages.name: Stealthily Approach The Lair
passages.text:
<<set $positionY -= 1>>
<<if $forestMap is true>>
Jacobi approached an entrance to the clearing marked on his map. Here, he could see the whole clearing. He knew he would find the beast here and kept himself hidden in the small alcove he had arrived at, hding between the trees and bushes. 
<<else>>
Jacobi approached a clearing from it's southern side. Taking a step further he instantly had a feeling of dread, as though he were crossing a threshhold into dangerous territory. Stopping fast, he hid himself behind a set of trees and bushes, examining the clearing he had arrived at.
<<endif>>

The thick canopy of trees had broken here, and Jacobi could see it was almost nightfall, and that his torches would still be useful for walk back to Toreal.

In the center of the clearing was a small lake,with dirt and algae turning it to a foul brown colour. He scanned the clearing more thoroughly, drawing his $weapon.
//The beast is here alright, I can smell the blood in the air,// he thought, waiting patiently for the beast to show itself.

And then, in the corner of his eye he spotted it. A sharp movement in the underbrush, disturbing the leaves and cracking twigs as it darted about. And then, as though it's rustling were a warning, it crept from behind the trees and bushes.

As it slowly crawled towards the lake to drink the foul water, Jacobi began to recognise his enemy. A monsterous Ghoul. Born into the world from the darkest depths of humanity they thirsted for human flesh. Generations of cannibalism  and depravity and turned what should have been human into an insane, hungry and deranged beast wanting nothing more than to rip the flesh from living creatures.

It stood a good seven feet tall, even with a hunch, and on each hand had three long nails as sharp as blades and covered in sickly, dry blood. It's dark hair was tattered and in knots and it's face was covered in sores and cuts. It's mouth was wide open and Jacobi could see it's razor sharp teeth as it lapped slowly from the water.

Jacobi raised his weapon and prepared to attack the monster without warning.

[[Sneak up and Attack The Ghoul from behind|Sneak Attack]]

Jacobi approached what seemed to be the remains of another poor soul who had entered the woods. His body had been twisted and mangled by the beast, his face barely beyond recognition to any who might know him. Along his back were three large wounds running along his spine, as though he was cut deep by multiple attackers. But Jacobi knew these marks well, and Jacobi knew the beast he hunted would not go down easy.
//Damn Ghouls, and if one's hunting this close to a village then it's no surprise the townsfolk are scared out of their minds.//

	<<if $girlTTalk is true>>
Jacobi looked closer at the body and saw a glint of gold clutched in the man's cold, dead hands. He pried the piece from the corpse's fingers, and saw it was a small locket, engraved inside were Wedding vowes, masterfully crafted with exact precision.
On the back it read, "For Miranda and Timothy."
//Poor girl,// thought Jacobi as he pocketed the locket. He pulled out his map and marked the location of the body. 
//Let's hope he gets a proper burial once im done here.//

+ 1 Gold Pendant
	<<else>>
In the mans cold, dead hands, Jacobi spied a glint of gold. Prying the small chunk from the corpses' fingertips Jacoi found a golden locket with the words "For Miranda and Timothy" engraved on it.
//This might fetch a nice price,// he though as he pocketed the item.
//Poor bastard, I'll make sure I'll get the damn ghoul lad.//

+1 Gold Pendant
<<endif>>
And with that, Jacobi returned to searching the woods

passages.name: Miranda
passages.text:
<<if $girlTTalk is false>>
As Jacobi approached the young woman she lifted her head towards her. Her shirt & face were sopping wet with tears and she seemed to blubbering, trying to speak through her sadness. She could tell why Jacobi was here in a heartbeat, for in a small town like this there was no one else but the guards who wore armour and carried weapons.

When she realized Jacobi was walking towards her she quickly pulled herself to her feet, leaning on a stone fence next to her pool of tears and sadness.

"You're h-here for whatever's in those w-w-woods. Aren't you?!" she called, barely getting the words out between tears and pointing towards the woods. Her body was trembling with what seemed like a mix of hate and sadness.

Jacobi stopped a few feet in front of her, and began his questioning.
"That's correct lass," he stated plainly, not wanting to add emotion and set this woman off on another bout of crying.

"If you're g-going in there then, I have something to ask of you", she blurted out. "And I c-can make it worth your while"
[[Listen to the woman|Side Quest-Toreal]]
<<else>>
Jacobi saw Miranda on the streets, still crying and waiting for a husband that would never come home. //I promised to find his corpse for her. Better put this thing to rest and let her get on with her life.//
<<endif>>
[[Leave her be]]

passages.name: Side Quest-Toreal
passages.text:
<<set $girlTTalk to true>>
//If she wants me to go in there, there's a good chance she might know something about the woods,// thought Jacobi.
"Alright then, you have my attention," he stated plainly again. The ride here had been long and Jacobi had little time to waste on the babblings of a mad woman, but a few minutes here would be of little consequence.

"A few days ago my.. my.. husband went into those woods, s-said if nobody was going to kill that th-thing then he would have to do it h-himself," she cried. Tears pouring form her eyes at the mention of her husband.

"He gathered a few men from around town, and they went into the w-woods on a hunt. I begged him not to go, I pleaded with him to stay and wait for more guards from Mayazar," she screamed, collapsing to the ground in a heap, distressed.
Quietly she contniued, "He didn't make it back that night, or the night after. I know he's dead in there and I have nothing left of him."
She went silent momentarily, still struggling to face the reality of her situation.

"If you can find his body, he'll have a locket with an engraving on him, a gift to him from my father on our wedding night. Inside was written our names, and it's the only thing we had that was truly our own, a symbol of what our lives would have been t-together." She couldn't hold it in any more, and more tears began to flow down her face.

"Listen," said Jacobi, kneeling down to look her in the eye. 
"Uh..," he began.
"M-Miranda," she replied.
"Well, Miranda, my name's Jacobi Kozlov, and yes I am here to kill whatever's hiding in the woods. I'll try and find this locket for you, but I expect payment."
There was no sympathy in his voice, he stated it all factually, but as soon as Jacobi had finished speaking she leapt from the ground.
"Thankyou, th-thankyou," she cried, "I promise you, you will be paid in full."
And with that she walked inside a house she was next to, smiling at Jacobi as she did so.
[[Walk The Streets|Villagers]]

passages.name: Toreal P2
passages.text:
Jacobi returned to Town during the night. The people of Toreal didn't know it yet, but their problems in the woods had coem to and end and. hopefully, life would return to normal around here. With the Ghoul's head hanging from his belt in a small hessian sack, he slowly <<silently>><<if $pHealth lt 50>>limped<<else>> walked<<endif>><</silently>> his way toward the local Inn.
It had been a long expedition, and the beast had put up an admirable fight; but training and skill would always beat out fierce animal ferocity.
//Time to get some rest,// thought Jacobi, as Toreal's Inn came into sight from the edge of the woods. It would be a long ride back to Mayazar in the morning.
[[The Next Day]]

passages.name: Find Miranda
passages.text:
Jacobi marched briskly through the town, searching for Miranda. He knew she would be near the Inn but how far he was unsure of. As he turned the corner onto the main street he saw her there. In the building she was crying next to he spotted her in the window. Crying profusely, and tieing a knot in a thick rope.
Jacobi's stomach instantly leapt into his throat.//Stupid girl is going to hang herself!// he thought. Rushing towards the front door he reached it within seconds and quickly went to bashing the lock in. 
At the first sound of a crash against the door he could hear her screaming, 
"Don't come in! Please, just leave me alone!" 
Her crying still audible through her yells.
"Dammit, you fool! It's Jacobi! I found your husband's locket now just open the bloody door!"
And with that final yell the door's lock gave way, and Jacobi tumbled into the room just in time to see Miranda place the noose around her neck. Their eyes locked for only a second before she kicked the chair out from underneath her. She began to kick and choke, tears still falling from her eyes, a sthough she would still be in agony even after death.

With only moments to react, Jacobi rushed forward into the room. Pulling out his $weapon he slashed across the rope holding up her choking, convulsing corpse. The rope gave way to the sharpened blade almost instantly, dropping Miranda to the ground.

She breathed, and Jacobi let out a sigh of relief. He sat down on the floor and held up her head, resting it upon his leg.
"I have something for you, you daft girl," he said, shaking, as he pulled the gold pendant from his back pocket.
"If you've got this then I don't see any reason to go looking for him, understand?" he said, staring at the rope still hanging loosely around Miranda's neck.

She stared at the locket for a long time, before finally letting out another bout of tears. But these were different, they were tears of joy, and in between Jacobi could hear he whispering "Thankyou..".
She slowly pulled the rope from around her neck. and then removed a small necklace whic held a green gem inside gold caging.
She stifles her tears, "Timothy once said this necklae would keep me safe if he were never here," she said, wiping tears from her eyes. "But now I have him back," she forced out, blubbering over the wedding pendant she held in her other hand.
"Take it," she said, handing the green necklace to Jacobi, "As your reward. you certainly need it more then I do."

And with that she stood up, threw the rope into her dead fireplace and hugged Jacobi.
"Good luck, my friend", she said, holding him for a few moments longer.

As Jacobi left Miranda's abode he placed the green necklace around his neck. The gem felt warm and comforting against his skin, promising safety and warmth, and have Jacobi a small spark of hope that his future would be just a little brighter with it. 

+1 Green Gem Necklace

[[Return to Mayazar]]
<<set $armourValue to $armourValue+1>>
<<set $goldTLocket to false>>

passages.name: Return to Mayazar
Clearing
passages.text:
Jacobi searches the clearing, looking for any scraps of humanity the ghoul may have held on to. Looking around he found a small hovel made into the base of a half-uprooted tree. The tree's large, thick roots acted as walls for what this thing might have called a home. Branches and twigs were piled around the edges in an attempt to camoflage it's home from predators and prey, while inside lay a bed of leaves the ghoul would have used for sleep.

Searching the hovel, Jacobi found few items of interest. Rusted and blood covered armour and swords lay scattered within. Practically all of which seemed useless and broken. Upon searching further, Jacobi found a small pouch hidden within a breastplate, alongside a small note. Th note itself was illegible, stained with blood and crumbled beyond recognition. However, along the top Jacobi spied the mark of King Twinning.
//It appears im not the only fool he's sent out into these woods,// he thought as he unraveled the sack, revealing a small handful of coins.
//Ha, and he only gave these bastards silver. Seems if you want something done right, then offer up some gold. Mine had better be waiting for me.//
Among the armour and weapons he also found a small locked box. A trinket of some kind, small enough to fit into the palm of his hand. Jacobi put this into his sack to inspect later.

+15 Silver Pieces
+1 Locked Box

passages.name: The Next Day
passages.text:
Jacobi prepared his horse for the ride back to Mayazar, strapping down his rucksack and sleeping roll to the saddle. The Ghoul's head was now stowed safely in a black leather pouch, hanging towards the front of his horse. He had kept it wrapped in the hessian sack to avoid blood leaking through his gear, and to not scare any villagers who would tread to closely.
<<if ($girlTTalk is true) and ($goldTLocket is true)>>
Opening his rucksack, Jacobi pulled out the small golden locket he had found on what he presumed to be the corpse of Miranda's husband. He recalled she said she would reward him greatly if he returned it to her.
[[Find Miranda]]
<<else>>
Around the town he heard somewhat of a commotion, with a few of the villager walking towards the edge of the forest. //News must travel fast here, they must be seeing if it's safe now,//he thought.
But as his eyes followed the crowd he saw that his work in the night was not the cause of the crowd, but rather a young woman.
There, at the edge of the forest, on one of the thickest branches of a dieing tree, hung the woman Jacobi had seen crying in the streets not a day before. Whispers of "She's with her husband now.." and "At least they didn't leave each other behind.." could be heard throughout the crowd.
//Lover's till the end, huh,// thought Jacobi, reminding himself of his own love life. And the consequences it carried.
<<endif>>
[[Return to Mayazar]]

passages.name: GuardHouse
passages.text:
The guardhouse was just as impeccable as it had been when Jacobi had left just a short time ago. Outside was a short, scruffy lad in a loose fitting uniform who was wiping down the windows. Typical guard behaviour meant having the new recruits do the dirty work while the old-timers sat around waiting for something to happen.

This was because Mayazar was not a city of crime or poverty. The general populace was happy thanks to the ruling King's work with the local guilds and trading houses. The King was a man who wanted perfection throughout his country, and seemed to stop at nothing to ensure this. The image of him passed through Jacobi's mind as he entered the GuardHouse, //I just hope he doesn't try and recruit me again after he sees all the "good work" I've been doing.// 
[[Collect Reward]]

passages.name: Collect Reward
passages.text:
<<silently>>
<<set $eavesdrop to false>>
<</silently>>
Inside, the GuardHouse was still impeccably clean, a fact that was quickly starting to annoy Jacobi as these men clearly had nothing to do; all the while he had spent the last few days doing work that ten of them couldn't accomplish. He made his way towards William's office, hoping he wasn't asleep again.

He arrived at the office to find William in a small meeting of sorts with some of the guards. He was speaking in a hushed tone, and Jacobi thought that whatever they were discussing might be worth listening to.

[[Eavesdrop]]
[[Wait for his men to Leave|Talk to William]]

links.text: Wait for his men to Leave

passages.name: Talk to William
passages.text:
<<if $eavesdrop is true>>
Jacobi kept himself hidden until the Guards left before entering William's office. //They've got enough to worry about without looking for me,// he thought, smiling. He opened the door to the office, hearing William shout out as he did so, "Oh what the hell do you wa- OH! Jacobi," he said, clealy startled by his arrival, "We didn't expect you for another few days." William was clearly flustered, and would have been morse so if he knew Jacobi was listening earlier. 
"Aye, it was difficult but nothing I couldn't handle," replied Jacobi, clearly acting smug.
He regained his demeanour of authority after a few short stutters and breaths, and continued.
<<else>>
Jacobi waited to enter Willaim's office. //Whatever they're talking about it can bloody wait,// impatiently tapping his foot as he stoof outside the door. Shortly after arriving however, two Guards exited the office and looked at Jacobi like they had seen a Ghost,
"Uh, William," the shorter of the two began, before Jacobi barged past them, clearly wanting a quick resolution.
"Ah you've returned," said William, almost as though he was asking a question, not quite believing that Jacobi was still alive.
"Nothing I couldn't handle", replied Jacobi quickly.
<<endif>>
"Well since this little expedition of ours has moved along a bit faster than I thought, I suppose you had ought to go and collect your reward. But of course you won't be able to enter the Royal Chambers with that thing hanging off yer belt." he motioned towards the leather sack around Jacobi's waist, which was just now starting to show signs of fresh blood stains and leakage from the hessian bag within.

"The Royal Chambers?" Jacobi asked, "You're telling me Edward bloody Twinning has my gold?" Jacobi sighed audibly, and William snickered at his reaction.
"Oh come now," said William, holding back a laugh, "I'm told you two go back a long time. His father had you join before the war, right?
But I'm sure you two will have plenty of time to catch up, for now just pass me whatever's in there and I'll send word to prepare your payment."

Jacobi reached into his leather sack and reefed out the hessian sack holding the head within it, throwing it to William in one fluid motion.
"Better be worth it," Jacobi said , nodding to the Ghoul's rotting skull.
And with that, he began making his way towards the center of Mayzar. Towards the Palace.
[[Talk to King Twinning]]

passages.name: Talk to King Twinning
passages.text:
Jacobi approached the palace entrance on horseback, it's gargantuan stone walls and imposing wooden gates reminded him of the entrance to Mayazar, as though the cities defense had been built from the palace's design. It was a smart move for the kingdom centuries ago, the great walls for the palace and city acted as a tieredsystem of defense, keeping royalty alive while the civilians died for their king.

The walls ran a perfect circle in the centre of Mayzar, protected on all sides with guards at every gate. As he arrived at the gate, Jacobi dismounted his horse and stated his business.
"He's expecting you, Monster Hunter," he said, spitting as he stated Jacobi's unofficial title. The man clearly knew of his exploits, and his betrayal years ago. The only reason his head was still attatched was becase the King needed him, or more specifically, needed someone with his set of skills.
[[Enter the Palace Walls|Mayazar Palace]]

passages.name: Prepare for the Journey
passages.text:
<<if $accepted is true>>
Jacobi left through the front gates, collecting his $weapon as he passed by the guards. //One more job and then I can go home, and right now she needs me more than ever,// he thought to himself, mounting his horse and heading to the Northern Side of town. His mind raced with thoughts of home.
<<else>>
Jacobi left through the fronts gates in a rush, snatching his $weapon from the guards on his way out. //This bastard thinks he'll get away with threatening her, let alone me. I'll slit his bloody throat if he ever comes near her.// He rode off towards the Northern edge of town, his bags still empty of Gold and his mind filled with thoughts of home.
<<endif>>

Before going to the Northern Market square, Jacobi felt it was worth visiting an old acquantaince at a local smithy. //If the King wants me killing bloody cultists, im going to need some better armour than leather.//
[[Visit Smithy|Armour Acquisitions]]

passages.name: Refuse His Offer
passages.text:
"Don't you dare bring her into this," Jacobi responded, seething and reaching for a weapon that wasn't at his hips in his blinding rage.
The King let out a hearty laugh that cut deep into Jacobi, building his rage even further.
"I knew she would bring out that fire in you," he said, finally turning to look Jacobi in the eye.
"Jacobi, it is because of her that you will do it. And if you don't, well, do I really need to force you into this? I'd rather not see your body dragged through the streets."He said, standing up from his chair and begnning to hobble towards the door. 
"I expect you to return within a week."
[[Refuse Again]]
[[Prepare for the Journey]]

passages.name: Mayazar Shop
passages.text:
<<if $mVisit is false>>
Jacobi found a small goods store nearby the central marketplace of Northern Mayzar. As he entered, a fragrance of honey and flowers flowed into his nostrils, and inside he found the source. A young woman with flowing blonde hair was attending to the stores wares, taking down item counts with a quill and parchment. As Jacobi entered she turned to face him, freckles dotted along her cheeks.
"Good day sir, how can I help?"
<<endif>>
Jacobi returned to the storefront, the scent of honey from the young woman still wafting through the air.
[[Purchase Supplies|Mayazar Stock][$mVisit to true]]
[[Check Inventory|Supplies][$mVisit to true]]
[[Mayazar City Centre][$mVisit to true]]

passages.name: Armour Acquisitions
passages.text:
Jacobi approached the Smithy, dismounting and parking his horse along the road. Mayazar had been booming lately, and people were flocking to the streets to sell and buy wares with local traders. All around townsfolk could be seen talking, shopping and walking the streets, a sight Jacobi welcomed after the desolate affair in Toreal.

Walking down the street he approached the Smithy belonging to his old friend, Elias Joachim. The man had trained Jacobi in his earlier years and led his troupe to battle many years ago, but Elias' true passion was for the crafting of weaponry and armour. As he walked into the open aired front section of the Smith he could smell the burning steel and coals of the fire, and it brought back pleasant memories of his youth training at Elias' orginal forge in the roaming green planes just northwest of Mayazar.

However, his thoughts were disrupted by the coarse, scratchy yell of "My word, if it isn't the Great Monster Hunter, Jacobi himself. Come here you mad devil!". Elias put his hammer down and hobbled over towards Jacobi, picking him up in a squeezing hug with his enourmous, tree-trunk like arms.
"Elias, I can't- breathe, you old fool," squaked Jacobi, surprised by his old mentor's youthful strength and eagerness to recieve him.
"Well I can guess you're not here on a personal visit," Elias said as he dropped Jacobi on the dirt with an audible thud.
Jacobi coughed, and regained his footing, "Unfortunately not old friend," he said clasping Elias' soot covered hands. "I've got a job to do, and sadly this old armour won't do. Any chance of helping an old friend out?"

Elias laughed, a booming sound echoing throughout the Smithy. "Old friend? My boy I think you're the only friend I've got left after these last few years of strife. I tell you what, leave that leather gear here and come back here just before sundown, and I'll have something wonderful for you."
"Thankyou, Elias. You don't know how much your kindness will help here."
Jacobi gave Elias a knowing look, as if trying to tell him something was wrong, and the fight ahead of him was strange, and would be difficult indeed.

passages.name: Kukri Blades 1
passages.text:
Jacobi's Twin Kukri Blades had seen a great deal of battle, but the enemies he killed with them barely saw it coming. Found in the Great Jungles across the sea, Jacobi had to pry the weapons from the cold, dead hands of a native during an expedition long ago and they had sevred him well since.

The lightweight construction and sharp edge on them allowed Jacobi to move swiftly throughout the battlefield, precisely cutting his opponents apart piece by piece. Wielding them felt like carrying nothing and let Jacobi dodge and move through his enemies with ease. Although not as damaging as a sword or an axe, the speed and grace the weapons afforded made all the difference.
[[Kukri Blades][$weapon to "Twin Kukri Blades"]]
[[Choose a Different Weapon|Weapon]]

passages.name: Steel LongSword 1
passages.text:
Jacobi's trusted longsword had served him well over the years. Passed down to him from his childless, blacksmith uncle, Jacobi had kept it safe and it in turn did the same for him. It was evenly balanced and made from a fine steel that could pierce almost any armour and still allowed him to move quickly on the battlefield. Jacobi preferred to use it two-handed, as his skills allowed him to block and parry with ease, and without a shield he could move much more freely.

[[Steel LongSword][$weapon to "Steel LongSword"]]
[[Choose a Different Weapon|Weapon]]

passages.name: Great Axe 1
passages.text:
Jacobi thought back to his days fighting the red orc horde with his trusty BattleAxe. Forged by ancient Dwarven smiths, he had found it in a expedition into the mountains long ago when he still worked as a member of Lord Twinning's military forces.

The handle was made of thick oak wood and the head was double-sided, forged from iron deep within the mountains. The weapon was heavy enough and large enough to act as a strong shield against attackers and could fell beasts with a single swing. But the axe was heavy as well, and that strength came at a cost to Jacobi's speed.

[[Great Axe][$weapon to "Dwarven Great Axe"]]
[[Choose a Different Weapon|Weapon]]

passages.name: Mayazar City Centre
passages.text:
Visiting the city centre Jacobi found some opportunities to gatehr information while waiting for Elias to finish his armour. 
[[Mayazar Shop]]
[[Visit Alchemist]]
[[Head North to Castle Ruins|Leave Mayazar]]
[[Check Supplies|Supplies]]

passages.name: Eavesdrop
passages.text:
Jacobi edged closer to the door to hear what the men were discussing, and heard William haflway through briefing them.

"...and if he makes it back, keep an eye out. Should be a few more days with the reports I've heard about this thing, if he even gets back."
A thud, //Fat bastard must've just dropped in his chair, and are they talking about me?// thought Jacobi.
"Anyway, we've got new orders from high up and it seems we're due for another search. Remember, any items or notes seeming to be of suspicious or magical nature are to be confiscated and their owner's brought to the stockades. Dismissed."

At that Jacobi quickly snuck away from the office door, waiting for William's men to leave before taking in his severed Ghoul head for payment. //Poor bastards would've probably wet themselves,// he snickered.

[[Talk to William]]
<<set $eavesdrop to true>>

passages.name: Visit Alchemist
passages.text:
<<if $alchVisit is false>>
//The local alchemist might know something about what's up North if it involves the dark arts. Twining sure as hell isn't giving em any information, might as well find it myself,// thought Jacobi, striding towards the bright green potion sign hanging in the main street of Mayazar.

Upon entering he found that there were other cutsomers here also, and decided to wait to speak to the Alchemist. Looking around he saw a great deal of concoctions with labels such as //"Insta-Growth","Light in a Jar"//, and //"Weapon Rejuvinator"//.
	<<if $lockedBoxes gte 1>>
But among all things he saw in the shop, one sign caught his eye, and it read "We Dispell Magic Locks". Below the sign pictured a small Box with a glwoing lock on the front and it reminded him of the small Boxes he had found in the forest at Toreal. //Perhaps there's more mages in the country than expected. I can't imagine what one was doing all the way out there.//
	<<endif>>
While he was looking at the signs and waiting patiently he heard a light male voice call out. "Sir, do you require any assistance?"
<<else>>
"Ah back again so soon, Sir?" called the mild mannered alchemist, his smile everpresent on along his face. "How may I be of assistance?"
<<endif>>
[[Talk to Alchemist about Cultists|Talk to Alchemist]]
<<nobr>>
<<if $lockedBoxes gte 1>>
[[Ask about Magic Locks|Lock Boxes]]
<<endif>>
<</nobr>>
[[Mayazar City Centre]]
[[Check Inventory|Supplies]]
<<set $alchVisit to true>>

passages.name: On The Road
passages.text:
Jacobi made his way towards the Northern Gates, riding swiftly through them past the blissfully ignorant guardsmen who stood watch. It would be a long ride to the castle and the King had given him a week to do it.
//Bastard,// thought Jacobi. //I'll have his head if even touches my Cassy. Too weak to even walk and he threatens her life as if it weren't already in danger.//

Jacobi's thoughts of hate and protection of his family drove him onwards through the night, barely resting as rode beneath the starry sky. The road North was more well kept than the one towards Toreal. Paved with brick for what seemed like endless miles, the road was commonly used by the armies of Mayazar sent through the the Northern Keep of Salazhar and was one maintained to reflect this. These days, however, the road had fallen into disreppair, and the longer Jacobi rode, the more broken road he saw.

Riding through the night Jacobi stopped only to rest when his horse finally gave in and stopped, refusing to ride any longer and gasping for air. It was time to rest.Dismounting, Jcaobi led his mount away and found a small stream, a few hundred feet few away from the road. He set up a sleeping roll and began to prepare a fire for the night.
[[Sleep for The Night]]
[[Check Surroundings]]
[[Check Inventory|Supplies]]

<<set $mapGStock to 1>>

<<set $northMap to false>>

passages.name: Mayazar Palace
passages.text:
The Palace was built from solid stone centuries ago, and although history made no mention of it, Jacobi was almost certain that many people would've died building it. It's towers reaching endlessly towards the sky, threatening to topple into the city at any given moment, while the castles's walls held firm over years of assault by neighouring countries. Burns, bloodstains and cracks lined the lower walls, a testament to the structures agelessness. An onlooker may see these and assume the walls were ready to crumble, but those who had seen inside knew the slabs used to build the walls were as thick as on oxen cart, and would not be crumbling any time soon.

Jacobi entered the Palace through the main hall, and found a guard waiting to take his weapons in the halls' antechamber.
//Just do what he wants and get out of here Jacobi,// he thought to himself, unhitching his $weapon from his belt. Entering the main hall he spotted a man at the far end, beholding one of the great tapestries of history that ran around the hall's walls. Upon stepping foot inside however, the man turned around, and Jacobi saw that it was King Twinning. And it seemed as though he had been waiting for him.

[[Talk with the King|Edward Twinning]]

passages.name: Edward Twinning
passages.text:
"If it isn't the renowned Monster Hunter, Jacobi Kozlov," he said, hobbling towards Jacobi. Although the man was younger by a good 10 years, he had not aged well. Years of stress and war had taken their toll on the man's body and he now walked with a cane, but he was still strong. He had been known to cut a men's head off with one swing from his blade, and still kept a good healthy glow about him. But his bones had become brittle over time.

"My Lord Sir Edward Twinning," Jacobi replied, bowing with both respect and annoyance. //Just let me out of here dammit,// he thought.
As he stepped closer Jacobi got a better look at the man. Although he moved with a slow pace his face still looked like that of a young man, his healthy family lineage showing in his withered state. His dark hair still flowed down over his shoulders, as thick and luscious as it had been when the man took the throne.

"They tell me you killed the beast in Toreal's forest. A Ghoul they say. I've seen one of those up front before, when my alchemists brought one in to study. I believe it was you who bought it in so many years ago."
Jacobi winced at the memory, thinking back to how long he had become bedridden after facing the canibalistic abomination.

"Aye, that was me," replied Jacobi, "And now I've come to collect my rewards, with your blessing my King." Jacobi bowed, almost retching as the words left his mouth, never having been one to appreciate the polite and courteous language of noblemen.
"Yes I do believe you are owed," responded the King, "But I have something else you may be interested in as well."

//It never ends with these people,// sighed Jacobi.

[[Hear What He has to Say]]

links.text: Hear What He has to Say

destination.name: Hear What He has to Say

passages.name: Run Away
passages.text:
Jacobi reatreated from the beast, losing torchlight during his escape.
<<silently>>
<<if $torchLight gt 0>>
<<set $torchLight to $torchlight-2>>
<<endif>>
<</silently>>
<<display Torchlight>>
//Good thing I got out of there when I did, but I can't keep running. I need to kill whatever's in here if I ever want to leave this place.//
[[Continue Exploring|The Dark Woods]]

passages.name: Hear What He has to Say
passages.text:
<<silently>>
<<set $accepted to false>>
<</silently>>

The King waved his hand and motioned for Jacobi to follow him to one of the tapestries lining the wall. Pictured on it was a mountain fortress, covered in armed soldiers. It depicted a battle from the King's glory days, when he and 200 men held the fortress against an oncoming horde of undead. The Fight of Life, many called it, before the Necromancer behind the evil deeds was finally captured and beheaded in the centre of Mayazar
"The great Northern Keep of Salazhar," said Edward, reminsicing in his glory days, "We held it long enough for my father's army to arrive, I remember the scolding he gave me afterwards, warning me not to put my life at risk like that again."

He paused for a moment, the man clearly respected his history, glancing around at the other tapestries around the room. It was common knowledge that King Twinning wanted to be remembered as a great king, if not the greatest that Mayazar had ever seen. He held history books and tapestries covering every one of the exploits and conquerings completed during his and his family's reign, and nothing would stop him from seeing his dream through until the end.

Continuing, he stated "It's been many years since that time, and the men in the north have become weak. I've recieved word that cultists have attacked once more from beyond the mountains, and I'd rather not risk an uprising in my lifetime."
He turned and began walking toward a chair at the hall's immensely long table. Taking his time to sit, he continued after saying "I need someone to go there and sort this out, someone I know can handle this task. Someone like you Jacobi. I know you were promised Gold and that you could leave to attend to your own business, but I need you up North. Route out the one behind this and I will double what you were promised, and we can forget about that unpleasentness in the war."
He paused for a moment as Jacobi considered his options.

"You know, the more Gold you have, the more medicine you can get for Cassandra", he said calmly, looking away from Jacobi. Although he couldn't see it, Jacobi knew the King was smiling at his  misfortune.

[[Refuse His Offer]]
[[Accept His Offer|Prepare for the Journey][$accepted to true]]

passages.name: Ignore 1
passages.text:
"So long as no beasts are here, I am fine resting on my own." Jacobi said. He didn't trust the old woman, for who would be out here on a night like this.
//I'm here,// the thought came to him as he wondered all this. But still, her rucksack appeard strange, and reminsicient of the ones he had heard of in stories of Gypsys in his days of youth. He began walking towards his horse when he heard, 
"The dark magicks of the North will take you, but perhaps you may struggle on yet." The woman knew where he was going it seemed. //Surely anybody heading this way is going to the Northern Keep.//
[[Ignore The Old Woman|Ignore 2]]
[[Talk to the Old Woman]]

passages.name: Talk to the Old Woman
passages.text:
Although his mentors had warned him of gypsy ways he, Jacobi had heard stories of their strange trinkets helping those in times of need. ALthough these stories were few and far between, and he had heard more bad than good, Jacobi decided to humour the old woman. Sitting down ona  rock nearby the stream he said "Alright then what do you want?"

"Ah for a warrior such as yourself only the finest wares will do

[[Gypsy Wares]]
[[Leave Gypsy]]

passages.name: Ignore 2
passages.text:
Jacobi had heard enought cryptic nonsense to last a lifetime, and returned to his camp, leaving the old woman to meditate.Before leaving he heard one final yell from her,
"You will need all the help you can, Monster Hunter."
//A gypsy how knows too much, that is for certain,// he thought.
[[Leave woman|Leave Gypsy]]
[[Talk to the Old Woman]]

passages.name: Search Hovels
passages.text:
It seemed the guards were clearing the area in search of something specific. Upon closer inspection, he found they were searching for magic trinkets and baubles left by defeated cultists. Some men were eyeing off rings and necklaces, unsure if any of them held any real power.
Lookin around, Jacobi found a destroyed hut that appeared untouched by the looting guards. //If there's something here that can help me I'd better have a look around,// he thought, as he began to heave debris away from the crushed structure.

<<if $strength gte 7>>
Moving aside a heavy wooden beam, Jacobi uncovered the corpsse of a small family, mother and child huddled together in fear. The faces were twisted in a look of terror in their final moments, and thier bodies were crushed beneath the heavy ceiling. Jacobi was repulsed by what he saw, stepping back for a moment.

Upon closer inspection however, he saw that the mother was wearing a small green armband that appeared to glow as he moved closer to it. //Cultists they were not, but someone gave them this,// he thought, slowly pulling the armband off of the mangled corpse. It was cold to the touch, like holding a chunk of snow in his hands, despite the fact it was still Summer. He put it around his own arm and instantly felt better, healthier almost.//A trinket for a loved one I suppose. I'll do my best to remember this gift,// he thought, leaving the bodies where they lay.
(+1 Green Ice Armband)
(+20 Max Health)
<<set $pHealth to 70>>
<<set $greenBand to true>>

<<else>>
The pile of debris became too much for Jacobi, his old bones givig way under the pressure of the wooden beams and stones. //I'm wasting time searching here anyway. I need to get into that castle//
<<endif>>

<<set $hovelSearch to true>>
[[Return to Outpost|Outpost]]

passages.name: Leave Mayazar
passages.text:
Before he left, Jacobi returned to Elias' forge at sundown, as they had agreed. He arrived to find Elias punding his hammer away at his anvil, and knocked on a wooden beam to get his attention.
Elias continued to work, but spoke."Sorry my boy, have to work late these days to keep a roof here. But luckily I had time, and your armour is ready." He waved his hammer to the side of the Smithy and Jacobi followed it's direction.

On the table against the wall lay a full suit of steel plated leather armour. "It's the best I could do on short notice. The steel should add some protection for you. And since when did you use such heavy leather? I can't imagine you moving very freely in that thing. Anyway I cut away some of the uneccessary pieces around your inner though and arms. It should be a great deal lighter now."
Elias continued to hammer away against his anvil, making a blade for a LongSword by what Jacobi could tell.
"Now get going, you wouldn't have needed that in a hurry if you didn't have somewhere you needed to be."
"Thankyou old friend," Jacobi whispered, and sunk away from the Smithy. The forge's light still bright enough to see as he arrived at the Northern Gate of Mayazar.
[[On The Road]]

passages.name: Listen to Guards
passages.text:
Jacobi approached where the bulk of the remainig forces rested. A makeshift barracks had been prepared within an assortment of tents and what still remained of the village outside the Keep. A group of 5 men sat around a campfire, discussing their next plan of attack. Jacobi eded closer to listen in on their conversation.

"What the hell were those things?", one man asked. "They're not even human anymore!"
"They still bleed like one," another said in response "And whatever those growths-", "Tentacles, Jim," one interrupted. "Yes tentacles, whatever. It seems to be slowing them down, all that extra weight."
"And that //extra weight// is what got Robert killed. It crushed him! I don't think I'll sleep right ever again after all this."
The men went quiet as they contemplated their friend's, and possibly their own, untimely death.
//Slow but strong ey, good to know. Just like the orcs of old, this should be interesting,// thought Jacobi as he walked away. He had heard all he needed.
[[Look around Outpost|Outpost]]

passages.name: Refuse Again
passages.text:
"No. Not again."
A silence fell throughout the hall, borken only by the sounds of King Twinning's cane tapping against the floor as he turned to face Jacobi. Fire welled up behined his eyes and Jacobi could see that his demeanor had changed. He now stood tall, without a hunch, and looked as though he barely needed the walking stick.
"I don't think you understand, Monster Hunter. This is a direct order from your //King.// Disobey me again and yours will not be the only body we drag through the streets. Your beautiful Cassandra will be there with you."
At the sound of her name Jacobi became tense, wishing he had a sword just to cut the bastard down.
"One week, now leave my sight." And with that, the King turned and began to leave
[[Refuse Again!]]
[[Prepare for the Journey]]

passages.name: Lock Boxes
passages.text:
<<if $boxVisit is false>>
"I see that you dispell magic locks here," said Jacobi, reaching into hs bag and searching for the chests he found in Toreal. 
"Yes, that we do sir," began the young man behind the counter, smiling happily as he spoke,"and for only a small fee of a single silver piece for each lock. Of course if it's anything more advanced than that of the Mage's guild of the palace I will need to see some form of identification." He stood there still as a rock with his grin as Jacobi produced his <<if $lockedBoxes gt 1>>boxes<<else>>box<<endif>> for the man to examine.
"Ah yes," began the young man" bringing out a pair of spectacles and exmaining it closely, "Seems to be something rather ameteaur here, I'd say the work of a first year trainee perhaps. Anyway," he put his glasses away, "we work on a Don't ask Don't tell policiy when it comes to where these came from specifically, so all I ask is you pay me and I can begin dispelling <<if $lockedBoxes gt 1>>these locks<<else>>this lock<<endif>>.
<<else>>
"I've got another box for you to work on." stated Jacobi, pulling out another small lockbox from his pack.
"Of course sir, remember, payment upfront," replied the smiling young man.
<<endif>>

passages.name: Talk to Alchemist
passages.text:
"I was hoping someone like yourself in the business of magic could help answer a few questions." Jacobi began.
"WHat kind of questions?" replied the young man, the smile slowly fading from his face as he saw Jacobi's serious look emenating towards him.
"It's about the some of the darker disciplines appearing around the realm. Maybe you've heard of them, perhaps something comeing from the North?" Jacobi questioned, clearly prying for information that could tell him what he would be up against.
"You have to be kidding me," said the young man, his face now empty of any emotion but hate and annoyance. He sighed.
"If you're asking about the cult that sprang up a few months back, those guys are the real deal. I mean, a lot of the more powerful magics are safeguarded by Mayazar's Mage guild, but when fanatics get their hands on a even a piece of that things go wrong fast. I've had people in here talking about their deformities and extra limbs and all kinds of crazy stories. Wouldn't have believed it until I saw some Guardsmen coming back from the North. Screaming bloody mary as they wer dragged off to the palace."
Jacobi felt somehwat stunned, //Boy, this kid's got a big mouth on him.//
His smile came back to his face, "But is there anything else I can help you with sir?"
[[Store|Visit Alchemist]]

passages.name: Check Surroundings
passages.text:
Jacobi walked around the small stream, checking his surroundings for evidence of animals or bandits.
Walking west alon the stream however, he came across an elderly woman meditating in the moonlight. Her haid was fraed and knotted in many places and she appeard to have been away from civilization for a long time. Beside her rest a large pack covered in twine and sticks; Jacobi couldn't make out any more in the pal light of the moon.

As he took a step closer the old woman opened her eyes and instantly locked them with Jacobi's single eye, appearing to stare directly into his soul. "Come, sit with me hardened one. You appear to need the rest."


[[Ignore the Old Woman|Ignore 1]]
[[Talk to the Old Woman]]

passages.name: Sleep for The Night
passages.text:
Jacobi rested for the night, dreaming of the day he and his wife could finally have peace. His small cottage in the open fields seemed like a paradise in his mind and a haven from the evils of the world. But he did not rest long.

As the first rays of sunlight broke past the northen mountains it was not the light that woke im, but rather a scurrying in the nearby bushes. Jumping to his feet and quickly grabbing his $weapon he dropped into a defensive stance, readying himself for an attack.

It was then he heard a distinctly feminine yelp and the scurrying stopped. Slowly, he inched his way towards the bushes. "Whoever you are, come out and I promise no harm will come to you," said Jacobi, tightening his grip on his weapon's handle.

At this command, however, the bushes moved once more, and a small elderly woman slowly edged her way out in the clearing he had made his camp for the night. It was obvious to Jacobi she was a gypsy woman, a travelling saleswoman and purveyour of magic trinkets. But the elder of his youth always warned him of their kind, cheats as they were all known to be.

On her back she held a large pack; straw and twigs piled on top of her sack of snake oil, false truths and trinkets. Jacobi sighed, "Leave me before I change my mind on killing you, damn gypsy." 
"But sir," she said, a smile widening across her face and a mishcevious look stirring in her eyes "You're ehading North, to the place of danger. Dark energies swirl and the cult dances through the night. I can see it in your eye, the way it darts to and fro across the mountain range."
 
Her voice was shrill and high pitched, seemingly as wildly worded as her hair, tattered in knots and frays and quite unsightly. The woman had not seen civilization in a long time, Jacobi surmised.
"If I am it's of no business to you," Jacobi said. He sheathed his $weapon and began packing his sleeping roll and equipping his armour, paying no more attention to the old hag.

"But sir what I hold here is what you need. They would be no match for the baubles I hold, if used in the proper hands.
[[Talk to the Old Woman]]
[[Ride to Salazhar Keep|Leave Gypsy]]

passages.name: Outpost
passages.text:
<<if $outpost is false>>
Arriving at the outpost, Jacobi felt an intense feeling of stress and tension throughout the camp so tighly he could have cleaved through it. All the mean still wore their armour, with some having even passed out near the edges still wearing theirs.

Nearby, some guards searched through a destroyed wreckage of a cottage, and upon further inspection Jacobi saw that an entire small village had been practically toppled around them.//Damn these bastards must be strong. What the hell have I gotten myself into.//

In the centre of the camp was Salazhar Quartermaster and head of supplies. He lookd tired and wated away, as though a breeze would take him if he let go of his table.//He might be of use,// Jacobi thought, tieing his horse to a nearby hitching post. //I might even be able to track some of the cultists around here before I go in if I get a chance.//

As he entered the camp he was greeted by the man in charge, a frail redheaded man who held a pile of parchments with order from high up. As he approached Jacobi, Jacobi pulled out the orders he had been given by the King and handed it to the man. Upon reading he quickly closed his mouth of whatever he was about to say, and left Jacobi to go about his business.
<<else>>
Jacobi looked around the outpost, eyeing off the weary men and wondering how long it would be before they decided to turn tail and run. The only ones holding the group together was the QuarterMaster, and the not-so-confident captain.
<<endif>>
<<nobr>>

passages.name: Leave Gypsy
passages.text:
Jacobi left the old woman with her wares, eager to continue his journey and return to the King in a timely manner.

He rode for another full day, stopping only to give his horse food and drink. He arrived at the Southern edge of Salazahr Keep at Sundown, and spotted a small camp on the outskirts flying King Twinning's flag. 
//The Guardsmen who were kicke dout of their own home, I'd guess,// he thought as he rode towards the fire.
[[Ride to Outpost|Outpost]]

passages.name: Keep Entrance
passages.text:
<<if $retreatK is false>>
Jacobi approached the commanding officer of the goutpost. 
"You boys have any plan of how to get in there?" he asked nonchalantly, as if they had a plan at all.
"Well sir,"stammered the red-headed lad. His leadership role was clearly unexpected, probably past on to him due to the last captain having died within the Keep. "The letter from the King clearly states you are to enter with our help, and we do have a strategy."

"Go on," queried Jacobi, becoming interested in what the young mna had to say.
"Once nightfall hits we are to take a ladder to one of the lower windows. There, a small well-armed team will infiltrate the Keep. The cultists have no real military strategy, so we don't expect heavy resistance. They believe their magic to be all-powerful and unstoppable, but the men here will change their view." As he began talking, he lost his stutter and had become entranced by his own military prowess. //Maybe this kid is a good leader,// thought Jacobi.

"Here, we will need someone to get to the lever which controls the main gate, if we can get that open our forces should be able to pour through and deal with whatever is left"
"And I'm to get to that lever, correct?" asked Jacobi.
"Unfortunately, yes. You're the most skilled fighter here and the King's letter states you are to be the vanguard."
//Of course it does, bloody bastard.//
	<<if $robe is true>>
"If its all the same to you, I have another way in. If we co-ordinate attacks your men can keep the bulk of their forces busy while I find the lever." Jacobi said, thinking of the hidden entrance he had seen the cultists use earlier.

The commander's face dropped, "Ah, I s-suppose so, but you had better find that lever or we'll be pulling out as soon as possible."
"Of course, sir," Jacobi said, with a mocking salute.
	<<endif>>
<<else>>
Jacobi made his way towards the group of men preparing for another attack. The commander ran him through the plan again of sneaking in under the cover of darkness.
//Let's hope we can kill the bastards this time,// he thought, making his way towards the entance.
<<endif>>

Jacobi had found where the leader of the cultists was, and according to the plan, it seemed they were protecting the mechanism that opened the gates. Jacobi slowly crept forward, hiding in the shadows of the corridor he entered from. The room before him was once the great Hall of the Keep. Now, the cultists had desecrated it with abhorent scriptures and imagery of sacrfice and ungodly creations. [[Stealthily Approach The Altar and Attack]]| <> <> <>
As Jacobi came to the end of a hallway, he spotted a corpse to his left which was neither a guard or a cultist. Instead, it was an inncocent priest, sent here to spread the good word of whatever God it was that he had decided to serve. //This is no place for the holy, let alone the unholy,// surmised Jacobi. In his hands he held a small sack, clutched tightly against his chest. [[Search Priest Remains|Priest Remains]] <> //Iv'e already pilfered the priest's corpse. Nothing else to find here.// <> <> <> <>
Walking through the great halls, Jacobi came across a deceased guard, his body battered and broken by the cultists twisted and perverse magic. //Poor bastard,// thought Jacobi, //Let's hope he has some help for the living.// [[Search Guards Remains|Guards Remains]] <> //Iv'e already taken all this guard had to offer. Nothing else to find here.// <> <> <> <>
Walking through the great halls, Jacobi came across a deceased guard, his body battered and broken by the cultists twisted and perverse magic. //Poor bastard,// thought Jacobi, //Let's hope he has some help for the living.// [[Search Guards Remains|Guards Remains]] <> //Iv'e already searched this place. Nothing else to find here.// <> <> <>
Approaching a crossroads within the Keep, Jacobi found that the way to the east had been blocked. Debris from a recent battle had fallen from the roof, creating a hole above and filling the hallway with bricks and ruins. //Looks like I'll have to find another way around.// <> <>
Up ahead, shrouded in darkness and surrounded by strange flickering lights lay a large stone makeshift altar, clearly carried in by some of the cultists. The intel from the guards suggested that this area was where the door mechanism was housed, and as Jacobi peered into the darkness he could see a large lever behind the altar. Standing in front of it was a large hooded figure covered in jewelery and glistening armour, chanting strange words above the altar. //This must be the one running the show, better deal with them before I open the gates,// Jacobi thought.

passages.name: Stealthily Approach The Altar and Attack
passages.text:
In the centre of the room, just mere feet from Jacobi's entrance, stood what Jacobi assumed to be their leader, wearing a barely touched robe adorned with jewelry and thick armour plating.On the altar lay a guardsman, bound and gagged attempting to plead for his life as the cultists chanted their foul language. Next to them sat the lever mechanism for openeing the gate.
//No way around it, it seems. I guess it's time to cut the head from the snake,// Jacobi thought, slowly unsheathing his $weapon as to not make a sound.

[[Sneak Attack Cult Leader]]
<<set $cultLHealth to 50>>

passages.name: Approach The Altar and Attack
passages.text:
The hooded figure was the only one here, their henchman sent to fight the attacking Guardsman at the front of the Keep. And with their backk turned and facing their Altar, Jacobi saw his chance to strike.

As Jacobi approached behind the altar, drawing his weapon, he began to make out what was on the altar before the hooded figure. Lieing there, bound and gagged, was a frightened Guardsman, attempting to plead for his life before the madman. Jacobi quickly rushed forward to attack before the man was killed, and gave away his position in attempting to do so.

Drawing his weapon as the figure turned he struck without hesitation, but whoever he was fighting, they were fast too. A glancing blow meant to sever the spine was barely dodged, and the robe was caught and ripped on Jacobi's $weapon, revealing the one beneath. 

A young woman with hair in tatters and knots, scriptures burnt across one side of her face and further down her neck. There was blood dripping from the side of her head, clearly Jacobi's attack had still wounded her, though to do the degree of his liking. The robe still hid more of her aberrations, but as she moved away from Jacobi, preparing for combat, he could something slowly slide out of a sleeve from the robe. 

A long tentacle, covered in bloodred spikes and the colour of bruised flesh slithered out. Thought not as thick and gruesome as those of the ones Jacobi fouught before, it looked far deadlier and faster. As it moved, she began to wave it around herself, and like a whip deisgned for brutal combat she snapped her arm forward and flung it towards Jacobi.

[[Dodge Attack|Dodge Cult Leader]]
[[Block Attack|Block Cult Leader]]

passages.name: Cultist Tracks
passages.text:
//Some reconnaissance would be handy, I'm not fighting wolves this time but men. And though they may be powerful, men make mistakes,// thought Jacobi as he ventured closer to the Great Keep, keeping an eye on the ground for any tracks. As he got closer to the Keep he darted between piles of rubble, debris and boulders in order to keep himself hidden. Up ahead, however, he spotted footprints in the dirt, with the distinct waving marks of a long cloak following behind them.

//I've found you now you bastards,// he surmised, following the tacks carefully.
<<if $dex gte 7>>
As Jacobi followed the tracks he came across his prey, two cultists keeping watch out side of the keep, against a seemingly flat wall.Their dark purple robes an afront to the royal colours, hiding their disfigured and hideous faces. As he was still a good hundred meters away Jacobi was forced to wait in hiding and watch their actions.After a short while, one of the two, what Jacobi assumed to be men, whispered to the other. The second nodded in response as the first walked away and towards the wall. With his position Jacobi could see everything and still remain hidden behind a set bushes and debris.

The cultist had pressed against the wall, revealing a narrow passage to within the hold, //They must have used the old Guard's escape routes to get in, but how the hell did know about that? Either way, now I kno where they've been getting in//, he asked himself as the first skulked away, the passageway closing behind him.
//If I want to get at least one of them then now's my chance.//
[[Ambush Cultist]]
[[Return to OutPost|Outpost]]
<<else>>
As Jacobi followed the tracks he came across his prey, two cultists keeping watch out side of the keep, against a seemingly flat wall.Their dark purple robes an afront to the royal colours, hiding their disfigured and hideous faces. However, as he edged his way forward his footing came loose, slipping slightly and knocking gravel away. 

At the sound of his mistep the cultists perked up, a red glow from beneath their hoods staring towards Jacobi's hiding place. He remained still for a moment, only to hear theor footsteps head in the other direction, followed by a loud 'clunking' sound as stone scrapped against stone for only a moment.
//I supposed this effort has been in vain, Shit,// Jacobi angrily thought, punching the rock of which he had hid behind.
[[Return to Outpost|Outpost]]
<<endif>>
<<set $cultTrack to true>>

She drops to her knees, clawing at he throat and gasping for air, the tentacle beneath her robe writhing uncontrollably and smashing against the makeshift altar. After a few short moments she stopped moving, with a final twitching of her fingers signalling her death.

After a moment of brief respite, Jacobi limped towards the main gate's control mechanism, a lever attached to a series of cogs and pulleys.
//Here goes nothing//, he thought, as he grabbed the handle and groaned, pulling it towards himself and into position. After a moment, he heard a groaning sound as the cogs began to move, and the sound of stone scrapping against metal rang out through the Keep's halls.

As with all his kills, he began the process of removing the target's head for collection, and placed it in his rucksack.
