passages.name: Outpost P2
passages.text:
Jacobi began his return to the outpost, sneaking out through side halls as the main force assualted the cultists. //Without their leader they should have no messiah to turn to, and will hopefully fall quickly if these men know how to fight//, he thought as he reached window looking out towards Mayazar.

He paused for a moment as he looked at the hulking city, looking bloated and ready to fall apart from where he stood. 
"I'll get you for this Twinning," he said, his words dying out as the night breeze took them. "Threaten my woman again and you're a dead man." He said, and leaped out of the window to the ground below.

[[Report to the Commander]]
<<set $gemSet to false>>

passages.name: Report to the Commander
passages.text:
Jacobi arrived back at the camp, where the inviting sound of battle could be faintly heard, echoing through the Keep's halls. Approaching his horse, he removed the the bloody head of the cultist leader from his sack and placed in his leather satchel. His pack was already beginning to smell from the blood it left behind.
//Time to get my Gold and get the hell out of this country,// he thought, as he tightend the straps of his saddle, ensuring a safe ride back. Mounting the horse he though ot himself, //I hear the beaches of Lyandria are good this time of year. Perhaps we can live in peace there.//

But his thoughts of a brighter future were cut short, and as he was about to leave the Outpost, the young commander began running to catch up to him.
"Jacobi!," he yelled with urgency, quickly running out of breath.
//Does this have no end?// he asked himself, bringing the horse to a stop. The commander stopped for a moment to catch his breath as he caught Jacobi. The night air was still cold and thinning, and he would need a moment.

"A messenger arrived," he gasped, "from the capital. Says he n-needs to speak with you immediately. King's Orders." He poined towards the centre of camp near the fire. There stood a relatively regal looking knight, and upon closer inspection Jacobi realized it was none other than a memebr of the elite King's Guard. //Whatever it is he isn't kidding around sending one of his personal guards. But I'm done with all this, whatever he wants, I've paid my dues to the King. Best go tell him to sodd off.//

Jacobi dismounted leaving his horse at the edge of camp. The Quartermaster was waving for him to come and speak, an uplifted look in his eyes.
[[Talk to Quartermaster]]
[[Talk to Messenger]]

passages.name: Talk to Messenger
passages.text:
<<if $gemSet is true>>
Jacobi waitedby his horse for a few minutes, dreading any message sent by King Twinning, and waited fr the Quartermaster to complete the fitting of his new gem. As he had prmoised, it was only a few short minutes before the man was finished with Jacobi's $weapon. 
Examining it, Jacobi saw he placed the gem in the weapon's hilt, holding it in place with a small iron band he quickly modified and clamped around the hilt. It now seemed to glow softly, and the blade shined brightly in the moonlight, aching to be used.
<<endif>>
Jacobi approached the King's Guard messenger slowly, dreading whatever message Twinning had sent for him.

The man was wearing full plate steel armour, lined with golden edging, and had a regal look about him, standing tall and proud while others around him hunched around the fire. As Jacobi approached , the man reached to his belt, pulling out a sealed scroll. "A message for Ser Jacobi Kozlov, from his lordhsip King Twinning. I've also been instructed to ensure your return to the capital."
The man spoke quickly and with purpose, confident in his mission from the King.

Jacobi took the letter from his hand and broke the wax seal with a dull hunting knife. 
[[Read Letter]]

passages.name: Talk to Quartermaster
passages.text:
As Jacobi walked towards the Quartermaster, the man quickly apprached, with a spring in his step.
"So you got that gate open ey," he said, the drawl still thick in his voice, reachig Jacobi. "We've been trying for the last week and a half to route these cultist bastards, and no luck. But you, good sir, you cleaved through their forces like they were nothing."

Jacobi began to smile coyly, it had been a while since anyone had actually thanked him for his work.
"The men have had a difficult time since being forcefully removed from what might as well have been their home. A morale boost certainly is in order." he continued, glancing towards the Keep, the first of the Guardsmen now beginning to walk out after the battle.

Many of them that Jacobi had seen were holding the robes, or parts of, belonging to the cultists, as if they were trophies of their kills. Some had even taing them to tieing them to poles as a warning flag for others that would try to take the keep. "Ah yes a morale boost indeed," said the Quartermaster, watching the men as Jacobi was.

"And I believe you found a great deal of those robes in there as well, did you not?" he asked, gleefully.
"The fabric was a good material, and I was hoping I might make some coin from them. Unless you have a better offer?" asked Jacobi. He could see where the Quartermaster was going with his little spiel and hoped a bit of friendly negotiation would do the trick.

"Well, depends on how many you have. Let me look at my stores and I'll see what I can trade you."
[[Follow Quartermaster to Store|Trade Robes]]

[[Talk to Messenger]]

passages.name: Escape Through the Smithy
passages.text:
Jacobi reached the Smithy, knocking down a lantern hanging at the front porch to and lighting another fire to cover his escape. As he ran through the soot covered Smithy a sudden thought struck him. //Why is there still a lantern on h-//. 
His thought was cut short by a large hammer racing towards his face in the darkness, barely missing him as he moved out of the way. Looking up, he saw the garguantan man wielding it. Clealy the local blacksmith of the town, covered in soot from his work and the raging fires.

"Fucking bandits, why? Why here!? WHY!!" hey yelled, swinging down with his hammer once more.
[[Dodge|Dodge Blacksmith]]
[[Block|Block Blacksmith]]
<<set $BSmithHealth to 45>>

Jacobi landed a blow on the big man, severing his spinal cord at the neck with a final strike. He immediately collapsed to the ground, blood seeping from his wounds. For a moment he twitched, before the last of his life drained from him.

Jacobi paid him no mind and ran for the back of the Smithy. The flames had begun to burn brightly and the screams of the villagers were all he could hear. Looking to the hillside, he spotted Ser Joren, watching over the madness.
//Good riddance you bastard, I'll be getting back long before you do,// he thought as he rode away from the village, the smoke covering his escape.

//I'm coming, Cassandra.//

passages.name: Robes for Gem
passages.text:
Jacobi picked up a small, roughly cut gem that the quartermaster had placed on the table. "I'll give you that if you've got a pile of those robes for me. Was a gem issued to the late commander by the Mages Guild of Mayazar. Sharpens any blade it does, but it'll take a few minutes to fit it to your blade." The man seemed almost reluctant to part with it.

It was a red gem, that seemed to sparkle and dimmer constantly in the moonlight. It's red tinge made it look os though blood were running through it, and on one side was a small symbolm remisicent of dwarven runes Jacobi had seen in his youth.
"I'll take it," said Jacobi suddenly, dropping a pile of robes onto the table from his rucksack. The qaurtermaster's face paled when he saw them, and he suddenly realized just how dangerous Jacobi truly was.

"I'll be back in a minute, make sure you fit that thing fast," he said, and made his way towards the King's messenger, patiently waiting by the fire.

[[Talk to Messenger]]
<<set $gemSet to true>>
<<set $damage to $damage+1>>
<<set $robes to 0>>

passages.name: Rest for The Night
Sleep
passages.text:
Awaking, Jacobi had little time to prepare for the journey, being rudely awoken by Ser Joren just before sunrise. They left without speaking to a single soldier, their job here was done and the men had a Keep to rebuild.

The ride southwest to Fjorna was slow, Ser Joren keeping his horse at a slow trot to make sure they didn't arrive at Fjorna too early. Jacobi was checking his supplies, making sure he had enough torches for what was to come.

//Can I really kill innocent people, just to appease this mad bastard King?// he throught, as the horses carried on towards their destination.Soon they would arrive at the outskirts of Fjorna, and prepare for the night.
[[Ride for Fjorna|Fjorna Outskirts]]

passages.name: Escape
passages.text:
Jacobi decided that he had was done with working for the King. He began to collect his thoughts and make his way towards his horse. It was time to leave for good.

//Once I do this there's no going back. I'll need to get to home, a full's day ride west and probably with no sleep, If I'm to get Cassandra out of here safely. Maybe we can go west to Singrial, I've heard of healing maic arising there. Could be all the help she needs.//

As he began preparing his mount for the ride a thought occured to him.
//If I leave Ser Joren here then I won't make it a day before more men are sent after me.//
He looked over at the man's tent, and saw no movement nor candlelight. He was clearly already asleep, resting afer his long ride to the Outpost.
He felt the weight of his $weapon at his belt, and asked himself if he could kill a sleeping, defenseless man.
[[Kill Ser Joren]]
[[Escape|Escape2]]

passages.name: Kill Ser Joren
passages.text:
//He's willing to kill a whole innocent village for that prick of a King. He deserves a shit death,// Jacobi thought, creeping towards the tent. His hand rested on the hilt of his $weapon, preparing to draw it at the first sign of movement.

The rest of the camp was already asleep, and as Ser Joren had decided to set up his tent outside of the perimeter, the darkness hid the area from any potential onlookers. It was the best chance Jacobi would have to kill the man and escape the clucthes of King Twinning.

As he approached the tent, Jacobi slowed his movement and breathing down in order to hide his presence. No mistakes were to be made here if he wanted to get out safely.

[[Open The Tent]]

passages.name: Escape2
passages.text:
//No matter what this man plans to do or has done, I can't kill someone in their sleep,// Jacobi thought, taking his hand off of his $weapon. //But I need to leave. Now,// he thought, mounting his horse and preparing for the tiring ride ahead.

[[Ride for Home]]

passages.name: Fjorna Outskirts
Open The Tent
passages.text:
Ser Joren's tent was made of a thick leather pelt, thrown over wooden poles and tightened with thick twine connected to small metal spikes in the ground. The capital spared no expense on it's military's equipment. Jacobi slowly ran his hand inside the tent's small opening at the front, being careful not to make any sound as he did so.

<<if $dex gte 8>>
[[Kill Ser Joren|A Knife in The Dark]]
<<else>>
[[Kill Ser Joren|A Fight to the Death]]
<<endif>>

passages.name: Ride for Home
passages.text:
The ride home for Jacobi was long and gruelling, having not slept the night before. The only thing keeping his eyes open and his mind clear was the thought of keep Cassandra safe and leaving the country with her, alive.

Journeying west, Jacobi passed the cobblestone road heading North out of Mayazar and glanced towards the great city. More and more it began to look as if it were going to burst out of its enourmous walls. Filled with the hidden corruption of the royalty that Jacobi had the displeasure of experiencing, as it was.

The city stayed in his sights for a short while as he travelled across the countryside, riding through plains and forests to get home as fast as he could. As Jacobi exited through another grove of trees, his idyllic cottage came into view, and he breathed a sigh of relief for the first time in weeks.

[[Go Home]]

passages.name: Go Home
passages.text:
Jacobi rode along the small plain just below his house, sitting atop a small hill as it were. It was the sort of place Jacobi had always wished of retiring to. A quiet cottage surrounded by glades of trees, and enough farming land to keep him and Cassandra content until the end of their days. But it seemed that end was fast approaching for Jacobi, his actions quite possibly costing him his happy future.

He appraoched the hitching post just outside of his cottage, and imediately saw that something wasn't right. The front door was hanging wide open, and mud and dirt had been smeared all across the front porch, as though a struggle of some sort had taken place here.

Quickly Jacobi ran inside, and his worse fears were confirmed. His home had been ransacked; cupboards lay wide open and empty, his food stores had been emptied, and Cassandra was no where to be seen.

He ran to the bedroom, looking frantically for his beloved wife. Still no where to be found. On the bedside table however, next to small vials and pouches holding a variety of his wife's medications, was a small, folded note.

On the front, was the wax seal of King Edward Twinning The III.
[[Read Note]]

passages.name: A Knife in The Dark
passages.text:
Slowly drawing his $weapon, Jacobi stodd over the sleeping man, preparing for what would come next. Ser Joren's breathes were heavy, and he had fallen into a deep slumber. Only a large disruption would wake him.

Jacobi placed his weapon over the man's throat, and with one quick motion, sliced his neck open. Immediately he awoke, clawing at his neck and gasping for air, blood spurting from his neck and flying out of his coughing mouth. His hand clutched at Jacobi's boot as the life drained form his body, eyes widening in horror as he stared his attacker in the eye. A moment later, his body lay cold and motionless. 

Jacobi sheathed his $weapon and made a quiet escape from the Outpost. 
[[Head for Home|Go Home]]
<<set $deadJ to true>>

passages.name: A Fight to the Death
passages.text:
As he entered the tent, Jacobi slowly drew his blade, and a quiet sliding sound of the weapon against his sheath came with it. This slight sound, barely audible outside the tent, seemed to be heard by Ser Joren, as he began to turn in his sleep, slowly awakening.
//Shit!// thought Jacobi,//Now's my only chance!// He lunged towards the man the moment Joren's eyes opened, and struck for the man's neck.

It appeared the man was more well trained than Jacobi thought, as although he hd no time to reach for a weapon, Joren lunged out with his hands, grabbing onto Jacobi's <<if $weapon is "Twin Kukri Blades">>blades<<else>> blade and hilt.<<endif>>

Blood quickly began to poor from the man's hand as he attempted to push Jacobi off of him, driving the $weapon deeper into his flesh.
"Kill me and your wife is as good as dead!" he yelled out, both trying to stop Jacobi and signal for help in the same breathe.

But Jacobi didn't stop. Pushing deeper into Joren's hands, slowly cutting at his tendons, Jacobi said to him, "Anyone who threatens her, they're as good as dead." And with his final word he pushed hard against Joren's hands, finally slicing through the man's limbs and plunging his $weapon into his chest.

With his final breathes, Joren gasped out a warning.
"He's going to k-kill her and you. Run h-home and y-you'll see....".
Jacobi wiped the man's blood from his blade, he didn't have any time to waste. Twinning's men would be looking for Joren soon, and his body would surely be found come morning.

[[Head for Home|Go Home]]
<<set $deadJ to true>>

passages.name: Read Note
Preparation
passages.text:
Jacobi spent the night preparing himself for what was to come. If King Twinning had Cassandra, then it would be a difficult fight getting to him.<<if $deadJ is true>>//And surely by the time I get there he'll know that I've killed Ser Joren, so he knows I'm coming,//Jacobi thought, checking over his medical supplies.<<endif>>

He began rummaging through his drawers and cupboards, looking for anything that he could use to get into Mayazar undetected. Searching, he remembered he had never gotten rid of his old Guard uniform from his younger days, and frantically searched for it. Hidden beneath his bed and under false floorboards, Jacobi pulled out an old wooden box.

Opening it revelaed a dusty uniform, dirty and creased from years of neglect. Beside it lay a standard issue, hooded, leather rain Jacket, and a pin for his years of service. //Never thought I would be wearing this around Mayazar again,// he thought, pulling out the old clothes and brushing the dust from them.

//So long as I wear these and keep my head down, I could almost get into the Great Hall of the palace without being seen.// 
<<if $sleep is false>> //But for now, I don't think I'll be of any use to Cassandra unless I get some sleep.//

Jacobi packed his rucksack for the day to come, and lay his head down on his bed. He could still faintly smell lilacs, Cassandra's favourite flower, as he drifted off to sleep.

[[Sleep|Ride for Mayazar]]
<<else>>
Jacobi packed the clothes into his rucksak, and prepared himself for the Journey ahead.
[[Ride for Mayazar]]
<<endif>>

passages.name: Ride for Mayazar
Enter Mayazar
passages.text:
<<if $deadj is true>>
Having little trouble entering Mayazar with his disguise, Jacobi headed directly for the Palace, for with Joren dead King Twinning would suspect something was wrong soon.
<<else>>
Jacobi entered Mayazar with little trouble using his disguise, flashing his pin of service t any who tried to question him. Joren would soon be returning to Mayazar, so time was of the essence to enter the Palace and escape with Cassandra.
<<endif>>
Reaching the Palace gates, Jacobi confidently rode through the entrance. A guard, however, stopped him in his tracks.
"The Palace is closed to visitors at the moment, return in the morning if you have business here."
"I'm here to deliver an urgent message to the King regarding the Cultist uprising of Salazhar. It's worse than we thought and the men require immediate reinforcements," resonded Jacobi, lieing through his teeth with authority in his voice.

"Shit, that bad huh," responded the guard. At that point, the second guard at the gates piped up, grabbing the one speaking to Jacobi.
"You idiot! Don't you see his pin?! Let him through, he's a higher rank than our captain even." He pushed his friend to the side.
"I apologize sir, go right ahead," he said, moving aside for Jacobi.
//Idiots,// thought Jacobi  hitching his horse near the main entrance to the palace.

[[Enter Palace]]
[[Check Inventory|Supplies]]

<<set $sneak to true>>

passages.name: Burn The Village
passages.text:
Jacobi snatched the torches from Joren's hand.
"Let's just get this over with," he said, and began walking towards the town. As darkness fell he reached the a house on the edge, and struck flame to his torch. Soon the village would be ablaze, and he would have no need for them anymore.
[[Burn It Down|Fjorna Village]]

passages.name: Attack Ser Joren
passages.text:
Jacobi had made up his mind. Killing this man was only his way out to safety. He waited for nightfall, when his intentions could be hidden by the pale moonlight. Waiting around the campfire, Ser Joren arose at the first sign of darkness, and went to gather supplies from his horse's pack.
//Now's my chance, while his back is turned,// thought Jacobi, slowly rising and following him closely.

"I'm sure you're aware of the woman's situation at the Palace. Correct?", said Ser Joren suddenly, stopping Jacobi in his tracks. //Did he hear me?//
"Excuse me?" responded Jacobi, his mind racing at the mention of a woman, for who else could he be talking about.

Ser Joren turned around, holding three torches in his hand. They had been freshly prepared and the smell of oil was strong. He sighed. "The King has your woman, fool. I've was instructed to wait until we reached here to tell you this. To //make sure// you would behave yourself."

He handed Jacobi the torches. "Time to go," he said, nodding his head towards the village, small groups of people could be seen going home after a hard day's work.
"Best time to go is while they're inside. The shacks tend to light up rather quickly," he said casually.
//Monster,// thought Jacobi.

[[Do as he says|Burn The Village]]
[[Attack Ser Joren|Attack Ser Joren 2]]

passages.name: Attack Ser Joren 2
passages.text:
Jacobi was done with this madness.
He reached down to his belt, and drew his $weapon, lunging at Ser Joren in the same motion. He may have been fast, but Ser Joren couldn't draw his weapon in time, Jacobi's skills and speed had been earned throughout a lifetime of combat, and this man was barely old enough to have served in the wars.

Jacobi landed on top of Ser Joren, pinning him to the ground. His $weapon struck had pierced Joren's arm, as he had raised in an effort to protect him while drawing his sword. He held Jacobi's weight above him, barely resisting the blade slowly breaking through his bones and steel plating.

"You'll hang for this," he strained, still trying to break away from Jacobi's grasp. "Even if you get that bitch back from Twinning, you can't escape Magia!"

"We'll see," responded Jacobi coldly. He leaped off from Joren, the man's arm now barely hanging by a tendon. Before he could even react, Jacobi was in him again, this time swing a blade down onto his neck, splitting his throat open and leaving him gasping for air.

"We'll see."
[[Ride for Mayazar|Head For Mayazar]]
<<set $deadJ to true>>

passages.name: Head For Mayazar
passages.text:
<<if $deadJ is false>>
Fjorna was hardly half a day's ride from Mayazar, and with Joren surely to be hot on his trail, Jacobi had no time to lose.
<<else>>
Fjorna was hardly a day's ride from Mayazar, and if Joren didn't return soon then King Twinning would know something was wrong. //I just have to get there and get out quick,// thought Jacobi, thrashing the reins of his horse as hard as he could.
<<endif>>
He arrived at Mayazar around midday, with the sun high in the sky. //If he really does have as his hostage, then there will be hell to pay,// he thought, approaching the city gates.

The guards who had seen him leave for Salazhar were on duty again, and let him through with little trouble.
[[Go to the Palace|Mayazar Palace-Day]]

passages.name: Enter Palace
passages.text:
Entering the Palace Jacobi found it was unnaturally quiet. Empty of the guards that would've held post at the grand doors and halls throughout it. As he moved through the great structure, he heard a muffled shuffling sound, accompanied by the clinking of armour plating, coming from the Great Hall.

Stealthily he moved through the antechamber to the room, and peekd out beyond the doorway. Here he spotted King Twinning, taing his place at the end of the hall's table. Next to him sat the woman Jacobi loved, Cassandra.

Flowing brown hair and smooth, pale skin, she was the image of beauty. Time had taken its toll of course, adding wrinkles to complexion and greyed her hair somewhat, but she beautiful to Jacobi. The only reason he had to live in this world was the love that woman showed him.

But she looked sickly, moreso than when Jacobi had left for Toreal just days ago. Wearing her white nightgown, Jacobi could see she still had not resetd since being taken from the cottage. She had clearly been deprived her daily medicinal treatment, and was shaking, terrified of the men around her and what they would do.

Between them, a small platoon of Guards kept watch, a dozen at least by Jacobi's count. Twinning was motioning for his men to go to the exits, and Jacobi heard his orders.

"If Joren returns with that man, kill him. Jacobi Kozlov is a traitor to the realm. Killer of beats and inncocents alike," he said, glancing at Cassandra at the word "innocents". Startling her she jumped, and tears began to fill her eyes, "He wouldn't, no. He's a good man, just let me wait for him at home and we I can talk to him."
"Sorry my dear but this is for your own protection," replied Twinning slyly. He had clearly been feeding her lies about the situation, and Jacobi was finished with the madness.
//He dies now. Even if I have to kill every one of these guards.//
Drawing his $weapon, Jacobi prepared himself.
[[Enter the Great Hall]]
<<if $greenBand is false>>
	<<set $pHealth to 50>>
<<elseif $greenBand is true>>

passages.name: Mayazar Palace-Day
passages.text:
He arrived at the Palace gates, stating that he was returning from a reinforcement expedition at Salazhar Keep to the guards. They had seen him come and go nearly a week ago with William's and teh king's orders, and had no reason to question his business.

Dismounting his horse at the palace entrance he prepared himself for the fight that would surely come. //If Joren was sent to kill me after we finished, then I'm sure he prepared for the man's failure.//

[[Check Inventory|Supplies]]
[[Enter The Palace|Enter Palace]]

passages.name: Enter the Great Hall
passages.text:
Bursting through the door like a great beast, Jacobi took the guardsmen by surprise. Moving fast, he grabbed the closest one who had was still offguard, holding his blade to the man's throat, keeping a hostage for himself.

"Well, well, well. Jacobi, it seems you really are a wretched traitor," said Twinning casually, glancing at Cassandra all the while.
"You leave her be, she has nothing to do with this!" yelled Jacobi, keeping his eyes on the Guardsmen who were slowly surrounding him.  He kept his back to the door.

"Oh but she has everything to do with it. Poor Cassandra here is the reason you came bcak to Mayazar in the first place. It's a shame those Cultists infected you with their madness. I was truly disheartened to hear about what you did in Fjorna."
<<if $sneak is true>>

"Oh trust me those people are still alove and well, no thanks to you," replied Jacobi. At this Twinning's face turned, and scowling he responded, "It matters not. Soon you and your sickly wife will no longer be my problem. Kill him."
<<else>>

"At your bloody orders! Don't listen to him Cassy, he's the one who's gone mad here. A whole village, burnt to the ground because you're afriad of a few measly spellcasters. Pathetic."
"Please just calm down my love, and we can talk about this," said Cassandra, scared and breathing in shorts bursts.
"Not until I get you out of here safe and well," said Jacobi, watching the Guardsmen's every movement as he spoke.
"It matters not," said Twinning.
"As an enemy of the state, I hereby sentence you to die. Kill Him."
<<endif>>
And with that order, the men charged at Jacobi, ignoring their comrade he used as a shield.

[[Save Cassandra]]

passages.name: Save Cassandra
passages.text:
The Guardsmen charge at Jacobi, piercing through their comrade with their longswords, trying to hit him in the process. He dropped the guardsmen before the blades could reach through him, leaping to the side yet still surrounded in their relentless onslaught.

passages.name: Inspect Machine
passages.text:
Approaching the hand-cranked machine, Jacobi saw that it had been some time since its last use. Flakes of rust had begun to form along its edges where sap had pooled, and the ropes and pulleys holding them in place had begun to fray at the edges.

As Jacobi edged closer to see how it operated, he heard a sharp "crack" and saw one of the ropes had finally given way. This caused a domino effect to take place, as other parts of the machine began to give way and fall apart. Jacobi had only seconds to react before one of the saws violently launched itself towards him, being rudely forced out of the contraption.

Barely escaping in time, the blade cut across Jacobi's forearm, the wound spitting blood almost instantaneously.
//Shit I need to wrap this now!// he thought, frantically searching his bad for a roll of gauze. His hand rested on a coarse piece of fabric, and he pulled it out of the bag, revealing a small roll of gauze for the wound. Moving quickly, he wrapped his arm and halted the flow of blood.

Sitting quietly, Jacobi took a moment to regain his breath and let his body recover for a few minutes.
//No wonder this place is empty, the workers must be terrified of that bloody thing.//
<<set $logger to true>>
[[Continue Searching Logging Camp|Logging Camp]]
[[Return to Town|Toreal]]

<<set $gauze to $gauze-1>>
<<if $gauze lt 0>>
	<<set $gauze to 0>>
<<endif>>
<<set $logger to true>>

passages.name: Refuse Again!
passages.text:
"I. Said. No," barked Jacobi, standing proud as Twinning's anger bubbled over. "I did your work, now give me the bloody Gold."
"You never were good at taking orders," replied Twinning, grinding his teeth at Jacobi's insubordination. "So be it," he said, snapping his fingers.

A large imposing figure appeard from the front gates, clad in solid steel armour lined with gold. Clearly a Kings Guard if Jacobi had ever seen one.
"Ser Joren, kill this traitor to the realm," said King Twinning. Jacobi reached for his $weapon, only to realize it was no longer at his belt, but rather at the front gate with the guardsmen.

His face went pale, as the large man charged towards him, sword out and ready to pierce his chest.
//I'm sorry Cassandra,// was the last thought through Jacobi's mind before being run through and impaled. His body was still warm when the King's Guard threw him to the hunting dogs.

passages.name: Charge King Twinning!
passages.text:
<<if $pHealth gte 20>>
Moving through the dwindling crowd of guards, Jacobi moved liked a deadly shadow, ducking and weaving through their attacks as they flailed in their attempts to stop him. As he moved closer to the centre of the room, King Twinning's face dropped in terror, as he saw his life begin to flash before his eyes.

Before the King had even a chance to slide the knife at Cassandra's throat, Jacobi was upon him. The King swiftky reached for his cane, revealing a hidden blade within and attempted to thrust it towards Jacobi. In those moments time seemed to slow for the two men, Jacobi's $weapon pierced into Twinning's chest spilling his corrupted blood, jewlery adorning his royal clothing dropping to the ground and ringing out like a bell in the great hall.

Jacobi looked down at the former King, choking on his own blood. Unfortunately Jacobi presumed he would be doing the same soon, as Twinning's rapier had pierced his side, and his only respite was the fact that the guards were still in shock. He looked towards Cassandra, grabbing a handful of the jewlery that had fallen before him. //She must live, even if I don't.//

In one smooth motion he grabbed a handful of the largest gems he could see and threw them towards Cassandra.
"Go! Get to Elias, he can still help you!" he shouted, turning to face the remaining Guardsmen.
"Jacobi!" she began, tears filling her eyes once more.
"I said GO!!" he yelled, turning back to see the woman he loved one last time as she began to run for the Palace Gates
//Now I just need to hold them off,// he thought.
"Come to me cowards!" he yelled, raising his $weapon for his final battle.
<<set $Ending to 1>>
<<else>>
//Jacobi dies killing King Twinning, Cassandra runs to Elias, tears in her eyes as she saw her husband die.//
Jacobi dashed  through the crowd of Guardsmen, parrying and evading their attacks as his wounds began to take effect, blood slowly pouring from his body. As he staggered his way towards the center of the room, twinning dropped the knife at Cassandra's throat and reached for his cane with inexplicable speed, revealing a hidden rapier within and thrust it towards Jacobi as the Monster hunter made his approach.

The two men met each other with a single blow. Twinning aiming for Jacobi's already emptying wounds, and Jacobi stabbing his $weapon into the man's chest. They stood for a moment, both held up by the other's blades. Looking past Twinnning and into the eyes of his beloved Cassandra, Jacobi coughed up a message.
"Get, to Elias. He, can help."
And with his final pools of strength, Jacobi flung the King off of his blade and into the nearest Guardsman, armour and jewelry dropping to the floor. As Cassandra ran for the exit, the Guardsmen too shocked by the death of Twinnning to stop her, Jacobi took one final glance at the woman he loved, before his eye closed one final time.
<<set $Ending to 2>>
<<endif>>
[[Epilogue]]

passages.name: One Final Attack
passages.text:
Jacobi charges King Twinning, attempting to spear him with weapons. Is cut down by Guards mere inches before reaching him.
Twinning Monologues and then slits Cassandra's throat.
Throws Jacobi's bag of gold in front of him as he laughs, while Jacobi slowly dies.

Jacobi began to feel cornered, surrounded by the slowly encroaching guards and bleeding profusely. His only chance to save Cassandra was to charge through the Guardsmen and kill King Twinning. Continuibg to bloack and evade the guards he waited for an opening, when a gap formed in the Guard's formation.

Using this split second opportunity, Jacobi leaped forward, reaching his weapons out to Twinning's chest, only to be stopped mere inches short by a guardsmens spear, impaling him through his chest. Twinning began to laugh maniacly, pressing his small blade against Cassandra's precious neck.

He stared deeply into Jacobi's eyes and slid the knife, spilling Cassandra's blood to the floor, mixing it with Jacobi's and the dead guards. Still barely breathing, Jacobi's eye followed Cassandra, her body draining of life and collapsing to the floor, his consciousness slowly fading.

"Poor fool," Jacobi heard Twinning say as he began to slide down the guardsmen's spear. "And all for a little bit of gold." His laugh was all that Jacobi could hear as he closed his eyes for one final time.
<<set $Ending to 3>>
[[Epilogue]]

passages.name: Epilogue
passages.text:
<<silently>>
<<audio dungeonsong volume 0.6 fadeout>>
<<audio mainsong loop volume 0 fadeoverto 15 0.5>> 
<</silently>>
<<if $Ending eq 1>>
Cassandra looked out across Tresindar sea, the smoke of Elias' forge blocking some of her view. The evening sun had cast an orange glow across the water and into the nearby village of Alderleaf, where the local alchemists and phsyicians were preparing themselves for the night.

Sitting on a rocking chair on her cottage's small porch, she smiled, as for the first time since Jacobi's sacrfice she finally began to feel at peace. //So this is what you wanted for us,// she thought, a single tear rolling down her face. She rose from the chair and began to walk towards the water, plucking a flower from he small garden as she passed it by.

At the water's edge, a small gravestone lay hidden next to a mound of boulders. It read 
//May he rest peacefully, and know no more pain.//
		//Jacobi Kozlov//
//Husband, Warrior, Protector.//

She bent down and placed the flower in front of the small memorial, and turned once more to face the calming sea.
//You would've been happy here, my love.//
----
Ending Gained: //A Brighter Future//
----
[[Game Completed]]
<<endif>>
	
<<if $Ending eq 2>>
Cassandra stared out longingly towards the the Tresindar Sea, smoke from Elias' forge sweeping past her view through her bedside window. The evening sun cast an orange glow across the sea, and up to the small town of Alchemists behind in Alderleaf. She could hear the tapping of her physician's shoes quiten as she walked home for the night, accepting another small payment from Elias for her care of Cassandra.

//I'm sorry Jacobi, first you and now Elias. How long before I am no longer a burden to the ones that love me.// Tears began to roll down her eyes, still to weak to even visit her husband's grave. As the sun dropped below the horizon, the only sounds that could be heard was the lapping of the waves, and the steady banging of Elias' hammer on steel.
----
Ending Gained: //Lover's End//
----
[[Game Completed]]
<<endif>>		
		
<<if $Ending eq 3>>
Edward Twinning climbed the stairwell of the Palace's northern tower, his cane creating a steady tapping rhythm the echoed down thrugh the tower. The corpses left behind in the great hall had been cleaned out days ago but the smell of death still hung in the air.

Reaching the top of the tower he arrived in his game room, animal furs lining the floor and trophies adorning the walls. He made his way towards the balcony, hobbling past Jacobi's $weapon mounted above the fireplace. As he walked out to the balcony he stared across Mayazar, and further out towards the Northern mountains. He spied the smoke rising from the villages at the mountain's base and smiled cunningly.
//You could never stop me, Monster Hunter,// he thought, as he reached for a bottle and began to pour himself a glass of rich, red wine.
----
Ending Gained: //The End of An Era//
----
[[Game Completed]]
<<endif>>

passages.name: The Ride Back
Contemplation
passages.text:
Jacobi stood silently for a few short minutes. //Killing innocents,// he thought, his mind empty of all else. //He wants me to kill a whole village. His own citizens, just for the possibility of a few cultists.// He took a seat by the fire, his face dropping from the realization of what he would soon have to do to keep Cassandra safe and alive.

"We'll be leaving at first light," interjected Ser Joren, "Hopefully we'll arrive at Fjorna just before sundown. We'll be able to make camp, and you can complete your task once nightfall comes."
Then it hit him, //He know what the King wants me to do,// all colour quickly draining from Jacobi's face. //This prick's not a messenger. He's a babysitter, here to make sure I burn the village to the ground.//
"I'm guessing you will need some rest, after what you've done here today," said Ser Joren.
"Remember, first light," he said, making his way towards his tent, set up just outside the outpost's perimeter. Like a sheep dog watching it's flock, the man would make sure that Jacobi wouldn't be leaving his watchful eyes.

[[Rest for The Night]]
